title: The divine root conceives, its source revealed; Mind and nature nurtured, the Great Dao is born.
Fully awoke to Bodhi’s wondrous truths; He cuts off Māra, returns to the root, and joins Primal Spirit.
Four Seas and a Thousand Mountains all bow to submit; From Ninefold Darkness ten species’ names are removed.
Appointed a Ban-Horse, could he be content? Named Equal to Heaven, he’s still not appeased.
Disrupting the Peach Festival, the Great Sage steals elixir; With revolt in Heaven, many gods would seize the fiend.
Guanyin, attending the banquet, inquires into the cause; The Little Sage, exerting his power, subdues the Great Sage.
From the Eight Trigrams Brazier the Great Sage escapes; Beneath the Five Phases Mountain, Mind Monkey is still.
Our Buddha makes scriptures to impart ultimate bliss; Guanyin receives the decree to go up to Chang’an.
Chen Guangrui, going to his post, meets disaster; Monk River Float, avenging his parents, repays his roots.
The Old Dragon King’s foolish schemes transgress Heaven’s decrees; Prime Minister Wei’s letter seeks help from an official of the dead.
Having toured the Underworld, Taizong returns to life; Having presented melons and fruits, Liu Quan marries again.
The Tang emperor, firmly sincere, convenes a Grand Mass; Guanyin, in epiphany, converts Gold Cicada.
In the den of tigers, the Gold Star brings deliverance; At Double-Fork Ridge, Boqin detains the monk.
Mind Monkey returns to the Right; The Six Robbers vanish from sight.
At Serpent Coil Mountain, the gods give secret protection; At Eagle Grief Stream, the Horse of the Will is reined.
At Guanyin Hall the monks plot for the treasure; At Black Wind Mountain a monster steals the cassock.
Pilgrim Sun greatly disturbs the Black Wind Mountain; Guanshiyin brings to submission the bear monster.
At Guanyin Hall the Tang Monk leaves his ordeal; At Gao Village the Great Sage casts out the monster.
At Cloudy Paths Cave, Wukong takes in Eight Rules; At Pagoda Mountain, Tripitaka receives the Heart Sūtra.
At Yellow Wind Ridge the Tang Monk meets adversity; In mid-mountain, Eight Rules strives to be first.
The Vihārapālas prepare lodging for the Great Sage; Lingji of Sumeru crushes the wind demon.
Eight Rules fights fiercely at the Flowing-Sand River; Mokṣa by order receives Wujing’s submission.
Tripitaka does not forget his origin; The Four Sages test the priestly mind.
At Long Life Mountain the Great Immortal detains his old friend; At Five Villages Abbey, Pilgrim steals the ginseng fruit.
The Zhenyuan Immortal gives chase to catch the scripture monk; Pilgrim Sun greatly disturbs Five Villages Abbey.
Amid the Three Islands Sun Wukong seeks a cure; With sweet dew Guanshiyin revives a tree.
The cadaver demon three times mocks Tripitaka Tang; The holy monk in spite banishes Handsome Monkey King.
At Flower-Fruit Mountain a pack of fiends hold assembly; At the Black Pine Forest Tripitaka meets demons.
Free of his peril, River Float arrives at the kingdom; Receiving favor, Eight Rules invades the forest.
A deviant demon attacks the true Dharma; The Horse of the Will recalls Mind Monkey.
Zhu Eight Rules provokes the Monkey King to chivalry; Pilgrim Sun with wisdom defeats the monster.
On Level-Top Mountain the sentinel brings a message; At Lotus-Flower Cave Wood Mother meets disaster.
Heresy deludes the True Nature; Primal Spirit helps the Native Mind.
The demon king’s plotting entraps Mind Monkey; The Great Sage, ever adroit, wangles the treasures.
Heresy uses power to oppress the proper Nature; Mind Monkey, bagging treasures, conquers deviate demons.
When Mind Monkey is rectified, the nidānas cease; Smash through the side door to view the bright moon.
The ghost king visits Tripitaka Tang at night; Wukong, through wondrous transformation, leads the child.
The child queries his mother to learn of deviancy and truth; Metal and Wood, reaching the deep, see the false and the real.
One pellet of cinnabar elixir found in Heaven; A king, dead three years, lives again on Earth.
The child’s playful transformations confuse the Chan Mind; Ape, Horse, Spatula gone, Wood Mother, too, is lost.
Mind Monkey is defeated by fire; Wood Mother is captured by demons.
The Great Sage diligently calls at South Sea; Guanyin with compassion binds the Red Boy.
An evil demon at Black River captures the monk; The Western Ocean’s dragon prince catches the iguana.
The dharma-body in primal cycle meets the force of the cart; The mind, righting monstrous deviates, crosses the spine-ridge pass.
At the Three Pure Ones Abbey the Great Sage leaves his name; At the Cart Slow Kingdom the Monkey King shows his power.
Heresy flaunts its strength to mock orthodoxy; Mind Monkey in epiphany slays the deviates.
The holy monk’s blocked at night at Heaven-Reaching River; Metal and Wood, in compassion, rescue little children.
The demon, raising a cold wind, sends a great snow fall; The monk, intent on seeing Buddha, walks on layered ice.
Tripitaka meets disaster and sinks to a water home; To bring salvation, Guanyin reveals a fish basket.
Nature follows confused feelings through lust and desire; Faint spirit and moved mind meet a demon chief.
Mind Monkey in vain uses a thousand tricks; Futile water and fire makes it hard to smelt demons.
Wukong greatly disturbed the Golden Helmet Cave; Tathāgata reveals in secret the true master.
Imbibing, the Chan Lord conceives a ghostly child; Yellow Dame brings water to end the weird fetus.
Dharma-nature, going west, reaches the Women State; Mind Monkey makes a plan to flee the fair sex.
Deviant form makes lustful play for Tripitaka Tang; Upright nature safeguards the untainted self.
Wild Spirit slays brutish bandits; Wayward Way sets loose Mind Monkey.
True Pilgrim lays bare his woes at Mount Potalaka; False Monkey King transcribes texts at Water-Curtain Cave.
Two Minds cause disorder in the great cosmos; It’s hard for one body to realize true Nirvāṇa.
Tripitaka Tang’s path is blocked at Mountain of Flames; Pilgrim Sun baits for the first time the palm-leaf fan.
Bull Demon King stops fighting to attend a lavish feast; Pilgrim Sun baits for the second time the palm-leaf fan.
Zhu Eight Rules assists in defeating the demon king; Pilgrim Sun baits for the third time the palm-leaf fan.
To wash off filth, to bathe the mind, just sweep a pagoda; To bind demons and return to the lord is self-cultivation.
Two monks, quelling fiends, disturb the dragon palace; The sages, destroying deviates, acquire the treasures.
At Bramble Ridge Wuneng exerted great effort; At Shrine of Sylvan Immortals Tripitaka discusses poetry.
Fiends set up falsely the Small Thunderclap; The four pilgrims all meet a great ordeal.
Many gods meet injury; Maitreya binds a fiend.
Having rescued Tuoluo, Chan Nature is secure; Escaping filthiness, the Mind of Dao is pure.
At Scarlet-Purple Kingdom the Tang Monk speaks of past eras; Pilgrim Sun performs on an arm broken in three places.
At night the Lord of the Mind refines medicines; At a banquet the king speaks of the perverse fiend.
The monstrous demon’s treasures release smoke, sand, and fire; Wukong by stratagem steals the purple-gold bells.
By a false name Pilgrim defeats the fiendish wolf; In epiphany Guanyin subdues the monster-king.
At Cobweb Cave Seven Passions delude the Origin; At Purgation Spring Eight Rules forgets all manners.
Passions, because of old enmity, beget calamity; Demon-trapped, the Mind Lord with luck breaks the light.
Long Life reports how vicious the demons are; Pilgrim displays his transformation power.
Mind Monkey drills through the yin-yang body; Demon lords return to the true great Way.
Mind-Spirit dwells at home, and demons revert to nature; Wood Mother together subdues the fiend’s true self.
A horde of demons affront native Nature; The One Body bows to True Suchness.
At Bhikṣu he pities the infants and summons the night gods; In the golden hall he knows the demon speaking on the way and virtue.
Searching the cave for the fiend he meets Long Life; The proper lord of the court sees the babies.
The fair girl, nursing the yang, seeks a mate; Mind Monkey, guarding his master, knows a monster.
At Sea-Pacifying Monastery Mind Monkey knows the fiend; In the black pine forest three pupils search for their master.
The fair girl seeks the yang; Primal spirit guards the Way.
Mind Monkey knows the elixir source; Fair girl returns to her true nature.
“Priests are hard to destroy” completes great awakening; The Dharma-king attains the right, his body’s naturalized.
Mind Monkey envies Wood Mother; The demon lord plots to devour Chan.
Wood Mother, lending power, conquers the fiendish creature; Metal Squire, using his magic, extirpates the deviates.
The Phoenix-Immortal Prefecture offends Heaven and suffers drought; The Great Sage Sun advocates virtue and provides rain.
Reaching Jade-Flower, Chan convenes an assembly; Mind Monkey, Wood, and Earth instruct disciples.
The yellow lion-spirit in vain gives the Muckrake Feast; Gold, Wood, and Earth disturb with a scheme Mount Leopard’s Head.
Masters and lions, teachers and pupils, all return to the One; Thieves and the Dao, snares and Buddhism, quiet Ninefold-Numina.
At Gold-Level Prefecture they watch lanterns on the fifteenth night; In Mysterious Flower Cave the Tang Monk makes a deposition.
Three priests fight fiercely at Green Dragon Mountain; Four Stars help to capture rhinoceros fiends.
At Jetavana Park he asks the aged about the cause; At the Kingdom of India he sees the king and meets his mate.
Four priests are feted at the royal garden; One fiend vainly longs for sensual joys.
Falsely assuming true form, the jade hare’s caught; True Yin returns to the right to join Numinous Source.
Squire Kou gladly receives a noble priest; The elder Tang does not covet riches.
Gold-dispensing external aid meets demonic harm; The sage reveals his soul to bring restoration.
Only when ape and horse are tamed will shells be cast; With merit and work perfected, they see the Real.
Nine times nine ends the count and Māra’s all destroyed; The work of three times three done, the Dao reverts to its root.
They return to the Land of the East; Five sages become perfected.
